questions.label: Do you use any of the following security measures to keep your business safe?

positiveMessage.title: Excellent Security Measures!
positiveMessage.body:
You have implemented multiple layers of security protection, which significantly reduces the risk of break-ins and theft.

Key benefits of your security setup:

  • Deterrent effect on potential intruders
  • Evidence collection if incidents occur
  • Peace of mind for you and your staff

Continue to maintain and regularly test your security systems to ensure they remain effective.

recommendation.title: Strengthen Your Security
recommendation.body:
Great security starts with layered protection. The more barriers you have, the harder it is for intruders to gain access. Review your setup regularly and upgrade where needed.

Consider looking into installing any items you ticked 'no or unsure' for. Adding additional security items can help to prevent opportunistic crime at your business.

We recommend you speak to one of our Territory Business Advisors about your safety and security needs for your business.

You can also look at the NT Police Business Security Flyer for more tips.

subQuestions.label: Reinforced security glass or security film
subQuestions.helpText: Security glass or film makes windows harder to break, deterring break-ins and protecting against smash-and-grab theft.

subQuestions.label: CCTV
subQuestions.helpText: CCTV systems help monitor your property, deter crime, and provide evidence if an incident occurs.

subQuestions.label: How many cameras do you have?
subQuestions.helpText: Consider coverage of entry points, high-value areas, and blind spots. More cameras provide better coverage but require more storage and maintenance.

subQuestions.label: Electronic security system / Intruder Alarm System
subQuestions.helpText: Alarm systems alert you and authorities to unauthorized entry, providing rapid response to security breaches.

subQuestions.label: One way mesh
subQuestions.helpText: One-way mesh allows you to see out while preventing others from seeing in, enhancing privacy and security.

subQuestions.label: Security screens or bars on windows and doors
subQuestions.helpText: Physical barriers on windows and doors prevent forced entry while still allowing ventilation and light.

subQuestions.label: Security roller doors
subQuestions.helpText: Roller doors provide robust physical security for entry points and are difficult to breach.

subQuestions.label: Sensor lights or timed lights on entry and exit
subQuestions.helpText: Motion-activated or timed lighting eliminates hiding spots and deters intruders by increasing visibility.

subQuestions.label: Duress Alarm
subQuestions.helpText: A duress alarm allows staff to discreetly signal for help during threatening situations like robberies.

questions.label: Do you lock access doors after hours?
questions.helpText: Locking doors after hours is one of the most basic and effective security measures to prevent unauthorized access to your property.

positiveMessage.title: Great Job!
positiveMessage.body: Locking doors after hours is a fundamental security practice that significantly reduces unauthorized access risks.

recommendation.title: Secure Your Access Points
recommendation.body: Unsecured doors are a common point of entry for intruders. Implement a policy to lock all access doors after hours, use deadlocks, and consider controlled access schedules to reduce risk.

questions.label: How many external entrances does your property have?
questions.helpText: Knowing the number of entrances helps assess security coverage needs. Each entrance should have appropriate locks and ideally monitoring.
